Terra Renewal is a non-hazardous waste management company that takes a scientific and environmentally-responsible approach to liquid and semi-solid refuse disposal. We believe our process and philosophical approach is unique to the marketplace. When we look at our client's waste we see opportunity. We see the potential for positive transformation. We see waste repurposed. We see waste that can become eco-friendly fertilizer which reduces the need for synthetic fertilizer. We see waste that can become everything from feedstock, to cosmetics to bio-fuel. We see cleaner water entering our watersheds. Simply stated, we see the earth's future and it looks renewed. Our professional team includes more than 500 dedicated employees with hundreds of years of experience in soil science, agronomy, geology, regulatory permitting and compliance, transportation, logistics, public relations and customer service. Our service area expands daily and now stretches coast-to-coast. By allowing Terra Renewal to handle your waste you are not only improving the preservation of our planet's natural resources for future generations, you are also simultaneously improving the current ecological state of affairs for today's existence by reducing the size of our landfills, lessening agricultural erosion and making effluent water discharges safe and eco-friendly. Furthermore, by working with Terra Renewal, you and your company will also be rewarded with improvements to your bottom line by reducing your waste removal costs and a renewed sense of environmental responsibility. If you are looking to improve your waste management and your bottom line, while being a responsible steward for our planet, we would like to demonstrate how Terra Renewal can work with you.

To accomplish its goals, the foundation uses a variety of strategies. It supports training, education, research and projects that demonstrate the effective delivery of health care systems. It also allocates roughly one of every four grant dollars to research and evaluation. Grantees include: hospitals| medical, nursing, and public schools| hospices| professional associations| research organizations| state and local government agencies| and community groups. The foundation is based in Princeton, N.J.

WorkRecords is a cloud-based network platform providing solutions to major issues encountered when a corporate workplace includes a mix of employees, contract & temp workers, service & supply staff, outsourced workers, and inspectors & auditors - a multiple-employer workforce. 

Labor—both hourly and salaried—is typically a company’s largest expense and can be broken down into 5 categories:
 
 1.) Full-time and part-time employees
 2.) Contract and temporary workers
 3.) Service and supply companies’ workers
 4.) Workers in outsourced departments
 5.) Inspectors, auditors and volunteers

WorkRecords customers use the cloud platform to:
 
 - Track the identity, skills, and certifications of all workers from multiple employers 
 - Provide managers with real-time activity data to better track, manage, and allocate labor costs 
 - Establish financial controls to prevent vendor overbilling 
 - Capture detailed labor performance data for continuous improvement and expense reduction 
 - Match data from smart machines with appropriate workers 
 - Enable real-time communications and collaboration among all workers across all employers
